    "output": "Here is a Pytheus target that finally moves beyond \u201cjust another swap/router\u201d and taps into a new domain\u2014quantum\u2010percolation nodes\u2014by combining hybridized multimode mixing with chiral (non\u2010reciprocal) couplers. \n\nChiral Entanglement-Percolation Node  \n\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014\u2014  \nGoal: At each node of a 2D lattice you have four incoming Bell-pairs on the north, east, south and west edges.  You want a single static device that\u2014by which two detectors click\u2014selectively swaps entanglement to connect either the East\u2013West link or the North\u2013South link.  By engineering the internal asymmetry of the 4-mode coupler you can bias these two\u2010swap outcomes (anisotropic percolation), all in one passive linear\u2010optical node.\n\nHow it works:  \n  \u2022 Resources  \n    \u2013 Four SPDC sources make Bell pairs on (A\u2099\u2013B\u2099), n\u2208{N,E,S,W}.  A\u2099 goes off into the network; B\u2099 are idlers.  \n    \u2013 Idlers B_N,B_E,B_S,B_W are fed into one static 4\u00d74 \u201cchiral hybrid coupler\u201d (an arbitrary non\u2010symmetric unitary).  \n    \u2013 The four outputs of that coupler go to number\u2010resolving detectors H\u2080\u2013H\u2083.  \n\n  \u2022 Herald patterns \u2192 swap channels  \n    \u2013 Clicks {H\u2080,H\u2082} herald a North\u2013South entanglement swap: modes A_N & A_S collapse into a Bell pair.  \n    \u2013 Clicks {H\u2081,H\u2083} herald an East\u2013West swap: modes A_E & A_W become Bell\u2010entangled.  \n    \u2013 Other two\u2010click patterns are discarded (or can be designed to map onto diagonal swaps for more routing options).  \n\n  \u2022 Directionality control  \n    \u2013 By tuning the beam\u2010splitter ratios and internal phases of the chiral coupler (Pytheus will find the optimal non\u2010symmetric 4\u00d74), you set the relative success probabilities P_NS vs. P_EW\u2014implementing an anisotropic, directed percolation node.  \n\nWhy this is novel & exciting:  \n  1) Moves into the new domain of entanglement\u2010percolation networks: each node both purifies and reconfigures links on demand.  \n  2) Truly hybridized modes (4\u2010mode mixing) + chiral light (non\u2010reciprocal 4\u00d74 unitary) engineered to break swap\u2010symmetry.  \n  3) No dynamic feedback or cavities\u2014pure linear optics, SPDC + heralding.  \n  4) Generalizes to larger degree nodes (hexagonal, three-outcome routers) and to full percolation\u2010phase studies with tunable anisotropy.  \n\nSuggested Pytheus config (horizontal run example):  \n{  \n  \"description\":      \"Chiral percolation node: conditional NS vs. EW entanglement swap\",  \n  \"foldername\":       \"chiral_percolation_NS\",  \n  \"edges_tried\":      50,  \n  \"ftol\":             1e-06,  \n  \"loss_func\":        \"cr\",  \n  \"num_anc\":          0,  \n  \"num_pre\":          4,                        # four SPDC sources  \n  \"optimizer\":        \"L-BFGS-B\",  \n  \"samples\":          20,  \n  \"in_nodes\":         [],                       # B_N,B_E,B_S,B_W feed directly  \n  \"out_nodes\":        [0,2],                    # A_N (node 0) & A_S (node 2) are entangled when {H0,H2} clicks  \n  \"anc_detectors\":    [4,5,6,7],                # H0\u2013H3  \n  \"heralding_out\":    [[4,6]],                  # H0&H2 herald NS swap  \n  \"thresholds\":       [0.2,0.1],  \n  \"number_resolving\": true  \n}  \n\nExpert prescription:  \n \u2022 Run this once to realize the North\u2013South swap (herald H0,H2).  \n \u2022 Repeat with heralding_out=[[5,7]] for the East\u2013West swap.  \n \u2022 Compare success rates P_NS and P_EW as you tune the coupler\u2019s internal parameters.  \n \u2022 Tile these nodes in a 2D lattice to study directed quantum\u2010percolation thresholds and anisotropic entanglement\u2010distribution strategies.  \n\nThis \u201cChiral Entanglement-Percolation Node\u201d is a genuinely new network primitive\u2014not just a swap or router but a passive, tunable building block for percolation\u2010based long\u2010distance entanglement architectures."
